title: Font like Avant Garde/Futura, but different?
content:
Hi everybody

I am looking for a font that looks similar to Avant Garde and Futura, but less mannered and feminine. Something bold, plain and geometric, yet distinct. (No trendy bubbles, and no square gridnik)

Any suggestions?

Any new, good fonts that might be a little ahead of the trend?

(It is for a big, effective and experienced company that does indoor plumbing for public buildings and projects)
author: Henrik Tandberg

comments.content:
Nice, but It doesn't look like it's ready for sale yet.

I should specify that the Uppercase needs to look its best

Century Gothic. Big body, short extremes. Very geometric.  
So retro that it \*must\* be ahead of the trend.

. . .  
Bert Vanderveen BNO
